title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

06:53 <Dan18> Hello

09:04 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <Dan18> Hello  
09:31 <vmassol> hi  
09:31 <Dan18> i trying to use HQL query but need a bit of help  
09:32 <+tmortagne> XWQL is easier ;)  
09:32 <+tmortagne> did you read http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/QueryGuide already ? it's petty good start and provide some examples  
09:33 <+tmortagne> for both HQL and XWQL  
09:34 <Dan18> (cant find the basic query i used, one moment)  
09:34 <Dan18> yes, i looked at the query guide  
09:36 <+tmortagne> basically I use XWQL generally myself unless I need date dunction like year() and stuff which are not supported by standard JPQL  
09:36 <+tmortagne> s/dunction/functions/  
09:37 <Dan18> i found a guide for HQL so decided to use it  
09:37 <Dan18> http://docs.jboss.org/hibernate/core/3.3/reference/en/html/queryhql.html  
09:37 <+tmortagne> the good thing about XWQL is that it's a lot easier to read especailly when you start filtering on objects properties  
09:37 <Dan18> i felt is more comprehensive that what i had found so far on XWQL  
09:38 <+tmortagne> and generally far shorter  
09:39 <Dan18> #set($hql = "select obj.name from BaseObject obj where obj.className='AnnotationCode.AnnotationClass'")  
09:40 <Dan18> #set($results = $xwiki.search($hql, 5, 0))  
09:41 <Dan18> i wonder what is actually bound to results -- a list of objects? of strings?  
09:41 <Dan18> {{velocity}} #set($hql = "select obj from BaseObject obj where obj.className='AnnotationCode.AnnotationClass'")  
09:41 <Dan18> sorry i meant this query  
09:42 <Dan18> displaying results i obtains some renders objects in xml  
09:42 <Dan18> more specifically, also when i have:  
09:43 <Dan18> #foreach ($item in $results)  \* $item #end  
09:43 <Dan18> can i access custom added properties, such as $item.type (i added to the AnnotationClass class  
09:45 <Dan18> writing $item.type or $item.selection doesnt produce the desired results but displays "$item.type" an $item.selection" verbatim instead  
09:46 <+tmortagne> what $item.class give you ?  
09:46 <Dan18> class com.xpn.xwiki.objects.BaseObject :-)  
09:47 <Dan18> ok, got it.  
09:47 <Dan18> the result is a base oject not an annotatioclass object  
09:47 <Dan18> let me change that  
09:48 <Dan18> #set($hql = "select obj from AnnotationCode.AnnotationClass obj where obj.className='AnnotationCode.AnnotationClass'")  
09:48 <Dan18> ok, this doesnt work  
09:48 <Dan18> is also a bit funny  
09:48 <Dan18> how to i "type cast" $item  
09:48 <+tmortagne> no no  
09:48 <+tmortagne> that's not the issue  
09:49 <Dan18> ok  
09:49 <+tmortagne> keep the old one  
09:49 <+tmortagne> BaseObject is actually the java representation of your object  
09:49 <+tmortagne> the generic representation  
09:49 <Dan18> ok, so how do i access the "inner" object  
09:50 <+tmortagne> but i'm not sure it's complete when you get it that way  
09:50 <+tmortagne> normally you should get the document  
09:50 <Dan18> its not  
09:50 <+tmortagne> and get object in that document  
09:50 <+tmortagne> so obj.name will give your the document name  
09:50 <Dan18> <object> <name>Water.InTech PVCD Introduction</name> <number>4</number> <className>AnnotationCode.AnnotationClass</className> <guid>c46a6e85-3084-4abb-b68f-569443d21106</guid> </object>  
09:50 <+tmortagne> which you can use with $xwiki.getDocument()  
09:51 <+tmortagne> and then get the Object from the Document  
09:51 <+tmortagne> I think you can find some examples about that on xwiki.org  
09:51 <Dan18> thats one of the XML items in the $results  
09:51 <Dan18> i guess what i want is to create a table to summarises some of the properties of AnnotationClass, including properties i have added myself  
09:52 <Dan18> what is the preferred way to query that  
09:52 <Dan18> i would want this query in two flavors, one only annotations on a page, and two all annotations defined in a space (or document tree)  
09:53 <+tmortagne> generallyy we do as I told you, we filter documents by their object and you get object from the documents  
09:53 <Dan18> -- so you have to start with annotations find objects belonging to them and then work with them  
09:53 <Dan18> sorry documents they belong to  
09:53 <+tmortagne> but if you only want some properties you get get them directly  
09:53 <+tmortagne> in the select  
09:54 <Dan18> i had trouble with the select, let me try again  
09:54 <+tmortagne> look at the last example in query guide  
09:54 <+tmortagne> in the table  
09:54 <+tmortagne> the one abou tags  
09:54 <Dan18> ok  
09:55 <+tmortagne> you can see how XWQL is easier to read with those use cases ;)  
09:55 <+tmortagne> the "List all tags" row  
09:58 <xipe> has quit  
10:03 <Dan18> what am i actually querying -- the actual database tables in which custom objects are stored?  
10:04 <Dan18> or am i, sort of, navigating objects themselves as defined in xwiki  
10:05 <vmassol> tmortagne: the build is broken for platform  
10:05 <vmassol> [INFO] --- clirr-maven-plugin:2.3:check (clirr-check) @ xwiki-platform-oldcore ---  
10:05 <vmassol> [INFO] Comparing to version: 3.1  
10:05 <vmassol> [ERROR] com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki: Removed field ajc$interField$com\_xpn\_xwiki\_api\_XWikiCompatibilityAspect$util  
10:05 <vmassol> [ERROR] com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki: Method 'public com.xpn.xwiki.XWiki ajc$privFieldGet$com\_xpn\_xwiki\_api\_XWikiCompatibilityAspect$com\_xpn\_xwiki\_api\_XWiki$xwiki(com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki)' has been removed  
10:05 <vmassol> [ERROR] com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki: Method 'public void ajc$privFieldSet$com\_xpn\_xwiki\_api\_XWikiCompatibilityAspect$com\_xpn\_xwiki\_api\_XWiki$xwiki(com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki, com.xpn.xwiki.XWiki)' has been removed  
10:07 <+tmortagne> vmassol: is this new ?  
10:08 <+tmortagne> what's weird is that it's talking  about aspectJ stuff it seems7  
10:08 <vmassol> apparently  
10:08 <vmassol> yeah  
10:08 <+tmortagne> di we update clirr plugin ?  
10:08 <vmassol> I have just updated plugin versions locally  
10:08 <vmassol> could this be the cause?  
10:09 <+tmortagne> not sure if it's a feature or a bug to now look at aspects  
10:09 <vmassol> I haven't touched the clirr plugin though  
10:09 <+tmortagne> hmm  
10:09 <+tmortagne> is it broken on jenkins ?  
10:09 <+tmortagne>  checking  
10:09 <vmassol> haven't checked, was rebuilding locally  
10:10 <vmassol> I saw you moved some aspects 1 or 2 days ago  
10:10 <vmassol> I thought it could be related  
10:10 <+tmortagne> did I ?  
10:10 <+tmortagne> ha no it was a branch  
10:10 <+tmortagne> teh stuff about removing aspect from oldcore  
10:10 <vmassol> ok  
10:11 <+tmortagne> pushed the branc util i'm done with virtual extensions  
10:11 <+tmortagne> hmm 3.1 build is broken it seems  
10:11 <+tmortagne> but not master  
10:11 <vmassol> I changed the aspectj plugin version locally:  
10:11 <vmassol> -          <version>1.3</version>  
10:11 <vmassol> +          <version>1.3.1</version>  
10:12 <+tmortagne> crypto failing  
10:12 <+tmortagne> ok maybe they change some way to generat things but I tough clirr was looking at sources  
10:13 <vmassol> clirr is using class files  
10:13 <+tmortagne> what happen when you move back to 1.3 ?  
10:13 <vmassol> going to try that  
10:14 <+tmortagne> checking 1.3.1 release note  
10:18 <+tmortagne> there is lots of modifications between 1.3 and 1.3.1 but hard to select one in particular  
10:19 <vmassol> ok seems it works with 1.3  
10:19 <+tmortagne> it's atcually aspectj 1.6.7 -> 1.6.10 upgrade  
10:20 <vmassol> I'll add a comment in the top level pom not to upgrade to 1.3.1 for now but we need to report/understand the issue  
10:20 <vmassol> I'll create a jira for them  
10:20 <vmassol> and put it in the comments  
10:20 <+tmortagne> problem is that I don't quite anderstand what is realle the clirr failure here  
10:20 <+tmortagne> maybe it's nothing  
10:21 <+tmortagne> but clirr failing does not feel very good

16:31 <qwebirc63183> has joined #xwiki  
16:33 <qwebirc63183> Hey All, I just recently installed and have been using the XWord plugin, very cool. But i have noticed that if I open/edit an existing page and attempt to change an existing macro or anything inside script, it wont publish/save it?  Is this known, or am I doing something incorrect.  Thanks!  
16:34 <+sburjan`> qwebirc63183: could you send a mail on the users list describing your problem ?  
16:36 <qwebirc63183> Sure, will do.  
16:37 <+sburjan`> do you know the address, right ?  
16:38 <qwebirc63183> uh, can you tell me? then i wont have to look it up :)  
16:40 <+sburjan`> users[at]xwiki[dot]org  
16:40 <qwebirc63183> lovely, thanks!  
16:45 <+sburjan`> ;)
